content.description: This character of this climb is about equal in character to its namesake from that Primus song. Climb the step to a ledge. Work up the steep face avoiding the corner to a dynamic move to a jug on the easy slab above. Pretty contrived, watch for loose rock if you stray off route into the corner.
content.location: Follow the wall 75 ft upstream from ROUS and Beaver Fever past the overhang to where it cuts uphill. This route and a tr project are on an area of grey rock where the wall terminates into the hillside.

content.description: Start up large pockets / huecos and pull through delicate moves right of the first bolt (crux). There is a hidden two finger pocket next to the second bolt that makes the clip more secure. After passing the difficulties, move up following juggy pockets to a diagonal break. Continue up and left on a slab before moving back right up the steep headwall to the anchors.
content.location: Route furthest to the right (downstream) on the east toe of the buttress.

content.description: Slopers, pockets, flared crack, and thin slab, this climb has a little bit of everything, and itâ€™s all good! Start below the obvious line of large huecos. Crank through the lower boulder problem to these features. Move up steep ground using pockets and edges to a rest below the slab. Dig in your fingernails and pull the delicate moves above. Finish on a slightly runout section over easier ground to the anchors. 8 bolts to ring anchors, ~65 ft.
content.location: Follows the obvious line of huecos left of ROUS.
